feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 11 at 3:40PM AKST until December 12 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LONG DURATION HEAVY SNOW EVENT FOR THE HIGHWAYS... .A storm force front in the Gulf of Alaska is bringing precipitation to the panhandle. Warm, moist southerly air will lift into the cooler temperatures over the highways at higher elevations to produce moderate to heavy snow. Another front will push up from the southwest Tuesday morning which will transition
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 2:40PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow continues Monday into Wednesday for the Interior... Snow and blowing snow expected over the northern Interior through Wednesday. Two rounds of snowfall are expected over the next 48 hours, the first overnight into midday Tuesday, and the second Tuesday evening into Wednesday morning. The second round into Wednesday is expected to produce heavier amounts than then first
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Goldstream Valley and Nenana Hills; Nenana; Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 9:45AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW ALONG THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST THROUGH WEDNESDAY... Gusty northerly winds will persist across the Kuskokwim Delta through Wednesday. Wind gusts as high as 45 mph are forecast to continue along the Kuskokwim Delta coast and for Nunivak Island. No new snowfall is anticipated from Bethel west to the Kuskokwim

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 9:45AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLOWING SNOW ALONG THE ALASKA PENINSULA THROUGH WEDNESDAY... Northerly winds gusting to 45 mph are currently combining with persistent snow showers to reduce visibility to one quarter mile at times. This evening, snow showers should decrease in intensity, allowing visibility to improve somewhat. However, intermittent reductions in visibility to one half mile will remain possible.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 11 at 2:55PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Marginal Risk of Possible Flooding East Coast Areas Late This Week... The long range models are showing a stationary front over the Florida Straits to move northward and into South Florida late this week as high pressure slowly moves eastward over the Southeastern United States. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 9:16PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Icy Roads Developing... Roads remain wet, and falling temperatures behind a cold front will cause wet roads to freeze, resulting in icy and slippery patches on roads. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 4:33PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Icy Roads Possible Tonight... Roads across the region are currently wet from recent precipitation, and temperatures are expected to drop below freezing this evening. This may cause icy conditions, especially on raised or untreated surfaces. Motorists are urged to use caution because roads that look wet may be icy. Slow down and be

entry.title: Air Stagnation Advisory issued December 11 at 12:56PM PST until December 14 at 7:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM MST /10 PM PST/ THIS EVENING TO 8 PM MST /7 PM PST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...An extended period of stagnant air, with light winds and little vertical mixing. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest and west central Idaho and northeast and southeast Oregon.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 11:33AM PST until December 12 at 6:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Benton and Polk Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Luckiamute River near Suver.

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued December 11 at 8:23PM AST until December 15 at 5:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Life-threatening rip currents due to rough surf with breaking waves between 6 and 9 feet and locally higher at times. * WHERE...Beaches along the northwest to northeast coasts of Puerto Rico and Culebra.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 11 at 1:13PM MST until December 12 at 12:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected before turning to a mix of snow and freezing drizzle. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...South Laramie Range including the Interstate 80 Summit
